mainTopic.title: Epithelium
mainTopic.content_info: The uploaded materials in the PDF files are PowerPoint slides. There are several slides with pictures and diagrams on them, but you can find all the necessary information to form the questions from the slides that have text on them.

quizzes.question: What is the primary function of epithelial tissue?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To cover surfaces and line cavities

quizzes.question: Which of the following best describes the structure of epithelium?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Closely packed cells with minimal extracellular matrix
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Cells scattered within a large amount of extracellular matrix
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Loosely connected cells with extensive extracellular matrix
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Cells embedded in a gelatinous extracellular matrix

quizzes.question: What characteristic is used to classify epithelial tissue?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The number of cell layers and the shape of surface cells

quizzes.question: How is 'stratified squamous epithelium' best defined?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Multiple layers of cells with the top layer being flat
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: A single layer of flat cells
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: A single layer of cube-shaped cells

subTopics.title: Apical cell surface specializations and functions

quizzes.question: What is the main function of microvilli found on epithelial cells?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To increase surface area for absorption
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: To anchor cells to the basement membrane

quizzes.question: What is a key feature of cilia on epithelial cells?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They move fluid across the cell surface

quizzes.question: What distinguishes specialized epithelial cells from unspecialized ones?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Presence of unique structures for specific functions

quizzes.question: What role do goblet cells play in epithelial tissue?

subTopics.title: Types of Intercellular junctions and hemidesmosomes

quizzes.question: Which structure connects epithelial cells to the basement membrane?
What is the function of tight junctions in epithelial cells?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To prevent leakage of molecules between cells
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: To provide flexibility to the cell layer
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: To anchor cells to the basement membrane
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: To facilitate exchange of ions between cells

subTopics.title: Exocrine and endocrine glands of secretory epithelium

quizzes.question: How do endocrine glands release their products?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Through a duct to a surface
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: By directly diffusing through the cell membrane
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Through gap junctions to adjacent cells

quizzes.question: What characterizes exocrine glands?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They have ducts to carry secretions to a surface
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: They secrete hormones directly into blood
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: They store products within vesicles for future release
